entry.title: Greencrops, 4010 Green Forage Pea - Organic
entry.summary:
Vendor: William Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 9.95 - 85.45 (5 variants)

Very effective Nitrogen and bio mass
builder. 4010 peas are the best leafy forage
peas for plowdown, producing over
40” of green mass in 10 weeks. Best
practice is to allow three weeks before
seeding following crops. Mow down and
work into soil at flowering.

Widely used as a fast growing microgreen.

entry.title: Swiss Chard, Eldorado
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 2.85 - 718.85 (7 variants)

Improved Golden Sunrise. Fresh new colour for
salad blends. Bright orange stalks and veins with
contrasting dark green leaves. Can be used as
full-grown bunches or as baby leaves in salads and
braising mixes. Good frost tolerance. Matures at
45cm/18”. 32 days baby; 59 days bunching
Pkt contains 100-120 sds.

entry.title: Swiss Chard, Ruby Red
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 2.75 - 451.55 (7 variants)

Excellent for baby leaves or bunching. Dark green,
crumpled leaves with crimson stalks and veins. Sweet,
mild flavour. Plants grow 18” high. Also known as
rhubarb chard. 32 days baby; 59 days bunching
Pkt contains 100-225 sds.

entry.title: Beets, Early Wonder AC Strain
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 2.75 - 214.20 (6 variants)

Our earliest non-hybrid variety. Produces a topshaped,
blood-red root for all purposes. Tall green
tops are good for bunching. 60 days
Pkt contains 150-200 sds

entry.title: Beets, Bull's Blood
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 2.75 - 742.05 (7 variants)

The ultimate beet top. Dark red leaves and stems
add colour and zest to salads and cooked top
recipes. Beets are flat-globed and have alternating
red-white zones. Tops are 10-12” in height and hold
up well in the heat. 60 days Pkt contains 100-140 sds

entry.title: Sorrel, Green de Belleville
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 3.25 - 172.75 (6 variants)

R. acetosa All green strain with lemony taste.
Perennial | Ht. 45cm/18” | 800-1000 sds/gm.

entry.title: Dill, Bouquet
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 3.25 - 337.95 (6 variants)

A tall dill producing many flowerheads.
Annual | Ht. 120cm/48” | 450-500 sds/gm.

entry.title: Cilantro, Santo Organic
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 3.65 - 1340.70 (8 variants)

Slow bolting selection producing broad, fresh green leaves on strong stems. Excellent for bunching. Organically grown seed.
Annual | 50-100 sds/gm.

entry.title: Cilantro, Santo
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 3.25 - 532.00 (8 variants)

Slow bolting selection producing broad, fresh green leaves on strong stems. Excellent for bunching.
Annual | 50-100 sds/gm.

entry.title: Chervil, Brussels Winter Vertissimo
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 3.25 - 185.95 (6 variants)

Anthriscus cerefolium Brussels Winter strain.
A preferred selection with darker green leaves. Chervil is a delicate leaved herb that enhances the flavours of other herbs. It is one of the fine herbs used in French cooking. Best direct seeded and kept moist until growth is seen.
Annual | Ht. 45cm/18” | 300-400 sds/gm.

entry.title: Basil, Red Rubin Improved
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 3.25 - 207.00 (6 variants)

Improved Dark Opal. Develops deep purple
colour in less favourable conditions. Suitable for greenhouse growing. Great accent plant for containers. Interesting in salads.
Annual | Ht. 40cm/16” | 400-700 sds/gm.

entry.title: Greencrops, Buckwheat Organic
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 8.75 - 109.65 (5 variants)

Fastest growing summer covercrop. Buckwheat out
grows everything including weeds, making it a great
short term smother crop. While buckwheat does not
yield a large biomass, it is an excellent scavenger
of phosphorus and potassium releasing it to the
next crop.

entry.title: Greens, Mizuna
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 2.75 - 135.00 (6 variants)

Very prolific, bolt-tolerant green producing up to 200
stems with holly-like serrated leaves. Excellent in
gourmet salads and stir-fries.
Pkt contains 650-750 sds.

entry.title: Greens, Komatsuna
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 2.75 - 325.00 (6 variants)

Easy to grow. Upright, fresh green plant produces
tender, mild stalks with dark green, rounded leaves.
Good for salads and braising.
Pkt contains 500-650 sds.

entry.title: Greens, Garden Cress Peppergrass
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 2.75 - 137.35 (6 variants)

Lepidium sativum Peppergrass. A quick growing,
extra curly cress that is ready to eat in two weeks.
Tasty on sandwiches or in salads.
Pkt contains 1800-1950 sds.

entry.title: Greens, Red Garnet Amaranth
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 2.75 - 979.10 (7 variants)

Interesting red leaves with soft texture. Tolerant to
hot and dry conditions. Used to brighten up salads.
Pkt contains 1150-1250 sds.

entry.title: Winter Radish, Red Arrow / China Rose
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 2.75 - 89.65 (6 variants)

Long, rose-coloured roots with mild, white flesh for
fall and winter use. Produces pink sprouts with a
nice spicy flavour. 60 days
Pkt contains 300-500 sds.

entry.title: Winter Radish, Round Black Spanish
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 2.75 - 115.95 (6 variants)

An excellent black-skinned variety with crisp, spicy
white flesh. Up to 4” wide. Great keeper. 55 days
Pkt contains 400-450 sds.

entry.title: Winter Radish, Minowase-Diakon
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 8.95 - 86.50 (4 variants)

Widely used radish microgreen.  Produces a green, oval leaf, with a hot, peppery taste.  Fast grower

entry.title: Peas, Dwarf Grey Sugar
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 9.45 - 199.50 (5 variants)

A Sugar pea widely used for microgreens.  Produces a round, green leaf with a reddish tinted stem and a sweet pleasant taste.

entry.title: Peas, Oregon Sugar Pod II
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 2.85 - 136.75 (7 variants)

Large, sweet pods. Produces heavy yields of 4½”
long and ¾” wide flat pods. Large, 3-4ft vines
protect tender pods from the sun. Also known as
Ho-lan-dow. Developed by OSU. 63 days
Pkt contains 135-150 sds.

entry.title: Peas, Aladdin pvp
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 2.95 - 160.45 (7 variants)

Excellent processing pea for canners. It
produces high yields of 3” long pods with dark
green, medium-sized peas concentrated in one or
two pickings. Plants are semi-leafless and dwarf
growing to 18-28” high depending on time of year.
Aladdin is very heat tolerant so it can be grown as
a summer pea in many areas. (HR:F/BLRV IR:PM/
PEMV) 67 days
Pkt contains 150-175 sds.

entry.title: Onions, Evergreen Long White Nebuka
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 2.75 - 458.95 (6 variants)

Long, slim, white stems. Very hardy for
overwintering. Little to no bulbing. 70 days
Pkt contains 400-500 sds.

entry.title: Fennel, Finnochio/Florence
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 2.95 - 278.45 (7 variants)

Common fennel. Recommended for foliage use. Great in salad blends and microgreen mixes. 100 days. Pkt contains 150-300 sds.

entry.title: Kohlrabi, White Vienna
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dam Seeds
Type:
Price: 2.75 - 97.20 (5 variants)

Common kohlrabi with light green skin and white
flesh. Best used for salad blends and microgreen
mixes. 65-70 days
Pkt contains 150-200 sds
